website_summaries.verdict: Choose this Shark vacuum if  you need a versatile, lightweight model with a collection of attachments for multiple cleaning applications.
pros: Although lightweight, it offers reliable suction power for effective cleaning
Works on carpet and hard floors
Ample attachments including a pet tool
cons: Dirt canister doesn't have a very large capacity, and emptying it can get a little messy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't match description.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in product description vs actual product. Had standard attachments, not motorized pet attachment, no hard floor duster...went to Kohls, bought same exact model, same price and it contained all advertised attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It does NOT include the pet roller, the wood floor tool nor the pad!!
customer_reviews.text: I was loving it for the first 15 min. When I was trying the different tools I realized it didn’t come the pet tool, hardfloor wood cleaner or pad!! I have all wood floors and two large rugs but the main reason I got it was for the pet tools!! When I moved on to the next rug, the light turned red for no reason so I stopped and checked to see what was stuck but there was nothing..I removed the few hairs in the rollers and continued.. but no green light, no red light no movement in the rollers. I literally just got it today!!! So disappointed. Returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: A great, versatile lightweight vacuum. But...the hose connecting the roller/head has cracked and opened up and the vacuum has no suction with this hose broken. The roller is a sealed unit and can only be replaced with the purchase of a complete new motorized floor nozzle for $119.95
customer_reviews.author: JT Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Planned Obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: I loved this vacuum for nearly 2 years. Then the hose on the main head cracked. I googled it and it is a common problem. The only manufacturer’s answer? Buy a new head for more than the cost originally paid. Two stars because it worked great while it worked, however very disappointed with the blatant money grab of knowing their product fails and they refuse to offer a reasonable answer.
customer_reviews.author: Chakeara

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vaccuum I've ever owned. Disappointed because so many of my friends say they love their Sharks. Suction was mediocre on carpet, I have to go over the same spots on the floor 4 times. It blows debris/crumbs back towards me on hard floors. Maybe it works well for pet hair, but we dont have pets, we have messy kids. My old Eureka cleans carpets way better with much more suction, and a broom is quicker and WAY more thorough on hard floors. Would not recommend to anyone who is trying to vaccuum up anything other than pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: Britmd

customer_reviews.title: Lousy customer service.  Shark products not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for just under 3 years (purchased 4/30/15) and the last few times we have used it, the belt has come off the roller and stops vacuuming. We have taken the floor nozzle apart and replaced the belt on the roller. It's a pain in the butt to do as they are MANY screws. Today I called Shark to see about getting a replacement belt and was told that they don't sell them separately, you have to replace the whole floor nozzle for $119. NO WAY. A piece​ of crap. Never buying another Shark product.
customer_reviews.author: DiverGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent suction, easy to maneuver, easy to clean out. Versatile, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly efficient for its relatively light weight. It is easy to navigate under sofa's, and into tight corners, and makes step cleaning a cinch. The various utensils are easy to attach and detach, and the power brush roller is as efficient as more traditional upright vacuums. The dustbin is easy to remove and to empty out. There is a hair filter inside the dustbin which is permanently affixed but for which hair removal is also easy. We have had this unit for a little over a year and feel that it is well designed, made of high quality materials, and will probably last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SquadronMgr7580

customer_reviews.title: Works well on hardwood
customer_reviews.text: This is great at getting up cat hair and litter, however it seems like I turn around and find more small bits where I just vacuumed, maybe it's pieces that have gotten stuck to the wheels or something. Since the duat cup is so small you do have to empty it frequently, but this this is so light it's not a problem. I haven't used any of the attacents yet, I'll update this when I do. I did receive ALL attachments that the box says it comes with. It sucks that the mounting plate doesn't come with screws, you have to buy those separate.
customer_reviews.author: dementedlove

customer_reviews.title: Designed to be disposable if it breaks
customer_reviews.text: Initially, this was my favorite vacuum ever. A little much on your arm muscles, but otherwise great. Until I started having problems with the brushroll and discovered the unit is not serviceable and you cannot just replace the belt. They tell you to buy a whole new brushroll assembly for $120. Ridiculous and almost criminal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hose crack after less than a year, warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: The Shark was adequate for about a year, and then the hose in the 'floor nozzle' unit cracked. Called Shark and was told it wasn't covered under the warranty, $60 to replace. I asked, so what good is a warranty if it doesn't cover anything? No answer from Shark rep. I think we'll put the $60 toward a Dyson.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed. Works as well as my high power canister vac.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for mainly for tile floors and smaller cleanups instead of lugging out the canister vac every time. I was not expecting as much suction or cleaning power as the big vac, but the carpet attachment cleaned my area rugs just as well as the canister. The only drawback to having this as a main vac is that head is narrower than a full-size vac, so it would take more time to cover a large area. But, dragging and repositioning the canister takes time too, which you don't have with this lightweight vac. So maybe the time would be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Free thought

customer_reviews.title: Better than Dyson!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love my Shark vacuum! Its my second one. The suction is fabulous and its amazing what it lifts up out of my carpet. I have 3 dogs, one being a hairy beast (all 14 lbs), and two parrots, one that is sooooooooooo dusty! You do have to empty it out more frequently than a regular canister vacuum, but if you have a small apartment with minimal storage, this would be perfect. I use this as my quick clean up vacuum. I've been very pleased with my Shark vacuums. I don't know why one would spend triple the amount on a HEAVY and cumbersome Dyson!
customer_reviews.author: K George

customer_reviews.title: Hate. Hate. Hate.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vacuum I've ever owned. It's head is so small I have to go over spots 3 or 4 times to even pick up small (let alone bigger balls of pet hair) I can't even vacuum my living room without dumping the canister 3 times. I would love to take this thing in my back-yard and burn it. I cannot express how much of a waste of time this crappy vacuum is. Hate. Hate. Hate.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Hohensee

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like about it is that it doesn't really stand upright ...
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum has changed my life. It's made my 15 year old carpet in the entry door actually look cleaner, which never happened with my old vaccuum. My niece noticed right away when she came to visit. It has an endless variety of configurations. I've used it so far on my carpet, wood floor, tile, linoleum, couch, curtains, walls, and stairs. The only thing I don't like about it is that it doesn't really stand upright on its own when you set it down in the middle of cleaning. You have to lean it on something or let it fall to the ground. Otherwise, I LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still love it after over a year
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this vacuum over a year now and the suction power is still great. We are a family with 3 girls w/ lots of long hair & a dog. My only complaint is that I do have to cut the hair that wraps around the beater brush. This model wasn’t supposed to have that problem but the hair still wraps around. We have hard wood floors, carpet & tile - works great on all three. Yes, you need to empty the dust cup but it’s not a big deal once you get it down. Much better than buying bags! I still love it for its suction power & would buy another Shark!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Purrrfect for pet owners! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This vacuum is a mini might! Very easy to handle, gets under furniture easily and does a stellar job removing cat fur and dog hair! I purchased a Bissell hand vac for pet hair on upholstery and the hand vac attachment on this vacuum does a far better job with more ease! Our yellow lab leaves pin prickly hairs embedded in the furniture. We used to joke that she was harder to clean up after than all our Ragdoll cats. The Shark Rocket pet hair vacuum is the answer to your prayers! KUDO's and at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Bond

customer_reviews.title: Good vaccum, handheld needs work
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vaccum. Switching from floor brush, to rug brush, to handheld head is very simple. Emptying the dust is very simple. I like the dust cloth attached behind the floor vacuum attachment. I docked a star because the handheld attachment, with rotating mechanism, does not remove dog hair from my microfiber sofa as efficiently as my plain DustBuster. It DOES remove the hair, but you have to go slowly and make multiple passes.
customer_reviews.author: ksc

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏻
customer_reviews.text: If I could do it all again I wouldn’t buy this. We have a German shepherd who sheds like you wouldn’t believe. This hardly picks up any hair without the suction hole getting clogged. Also, the hardwood floor attachment is a JOKE! It sucks!!! All the hair sticks to the outside of the attachment. Not impressed and would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Katyface

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a light vac for quick cleaning of carpet, hard floors and stairs, between deep vacuuming with heavy Hoover. It picked up a shocking amount after using the Hoover, so no need for “deep” cleaning any more. Very easy to reconfigure. Seems well made, I think it will be durable. Well worth the higher price of similar vacs. You get what you pay for in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Spike61

customer_reviews.title: Best Vacuum ever !!!
customer_reviews.text: Does entire house as well as any vacuum I've ever had, including some high dollar brands. Super maneuverable around furniture, lamps, etc.. Bright LED lights. Extra long cord. Canister is plenty large for a family of four. Switches from bare floor setting to thick rugs effortlessly (one finger). Deep cleans heavy rugs. Detachable head for hand vac use. Unit is lightweight for superb handling. I don't even mind vacuuming anymore. Entire unit is light enough to hang on a small screw in the closet, which frees up floor space. One of my finest purchases ever, A++++++
customer_reviews.author: cc99

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum I ever had
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vacuum. Cord is LONG. Takes a bit to get used to the balance with the weight at the top. Goes right in chairs and furniture. I actually like the small dirt container. Hated emptying the large ones I had previously...made more of a mess than I cleaned up. This is easy to empty. We have a dog and cat, so lots of hair. Have to empty the reservoir twice each time I vacuum, bit that is ok! Powerful and easy to move around. Storage is good, just detach the motor with one click and hang it on the hook at the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUCKS....and not in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: Had it since the first week of December. Now, it is February and I can't return the item, but it is making weird sounds and loosing suction. It sounds good and strong then sounds like its choking. It doesn't have the same power it did when I first got this item. I would NOT recommend this to anyone who wants a lasting Vac... Seriously, not happy.
customer_reviews.author: lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Good powerful flexible vacuum system with a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly powerful vacuum at a good price. Lots of useful features. I have four cats, and this model does a very good job removing hair from my rug. The lights on the vacuum make it easy to see where I'm working. This model has a base that can be swiveled down and is very good at getting dirt out from under couches, beds, etc. The top of the unit detaches, and is good with hard surfaces, but not as good with carpeted surfaces of furniture. This unit is probably as good as a Dyson for perhaps 1/2 or 1/3 of the price. I highly recommend it to you.
customer_reviews.author: BarringtonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works on pet hair
customer_reviews.text: We had this vacuum for years, cleaning up dog and human hair on carpet and hardwood floors. It eventually died and we came back for another. We have a golden retriever and the shedding can be unreal. This vacuum grabs it all and holds it in the easy to empty canister. Easy to use, easy to clean. Doesn’t stand up on its own, but that’s literally the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Cancan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I spent $400 on a Dyson Animal Ball at the advise of several friends and I found it very heavy, cumbersome and difficult to use on stairs. The Shark is amazing! It vacuums all surfaces really well, including carpet and hardwood. It comes apart easily to use the small, handheld part on stairs. It's also great to use on baseboards. I never would have chosen a vacuum specifically with headlights but it is amazing what those headlights spotlight on the floor that I never would have seen without them. I am so impressed with this little vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: LES

customer_reviews.title: WORST APPLIANCE I HAVE EVER PURCHASED. I've owned five vacuum cleaners and this is the worst
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this vacuum leaner, it doesn't stand up, it does not clean up to the wall I end up with at least one inch from the wall of dirt, because the vacuum does not clean up to the wall. It's almost impossible to get filters it has taken up to 3 months in which they send the wrong size three times. I wrote the company several emails, several litters and never got a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine F

customer_reviews.title: The best vacuum for pet owners
customer_reviews.text: The best vacuum for pet owners. I have three long haired cats and this vacuum is absolutely a lifesaver. Light weight easy to store pull out and use anywhere anytime. Quick easy effective. I have owned one of these for five years and cannot say enough great things about it. You would think I owned stock in the company. These were Xmas gifts I bought for my mom and sister. They were missing the pet attachment that was listed as in the box, but Amazon replaced it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum very powerful and fairly light weight and it can be pulled apart for easy storage. It's easy to empty and requires to be done several times per area depending on the size of the room. Pulls up dog hair and dust/dander very well, I have 2 dogs with undercoats that shed like crazy in a small house with mostly carpet. It has lights on it which make it nice if cleaning in a poorly lit area or those dark corners. Comes with multiple attachments for almost any sweeping job you need.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: This sounds weird but I enjoy vacuuming now
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and lightweight. This sounds weird but I enjoy vacuuming now. The vacuum transitions easily from carpet to hardwood. The dust cup is small so it needs to be emptied often but it's simple to do with a touch of a button to release cup and another button to open and dump. The cord is very long and there are several different attachments for stairs, furniture, etc. with a nice bag to put them all in when not in use. The light on vacuum head really shows the hair and dirt on hard floors that you normally don't see and there is an additional light higher on handle so you can use the attachments and still see.
customer_reviews.author: vegchristine

customer_reviews.title: REALLY GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this Shark Rocket Ultra Light, Upright Vacuum Cleaner. Its everything I expected and more. Fits into small places an under the beds. Great suction an large dirt holding tank. Only thing I did not receive the black bag that holds the attachments. It was advertised in the video I watched? It would be appreciated if you would send the attachment BAG. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: pat m.

customer_reviews.title: I didn't receive what is advertised...
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to this vacuum for the "pet" attachment LIKE ADVERTISED. I received the vacuum with no attachment. I looked at the instructions to see if it may have been left out when it was packaged, but nope. This model does not come with the attachment. FALSE ADVERTISING. If I didn't need this so much right now I would return it. Now I have to purchase the attachment for $50+.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum is awesome. Pros: Easy to use Light weight Great on carpet or hard floor Easy to clean Can take apart and use on stairs Powerful suction Cons: Hair string get trapped in the brush roller It does not stand up on its own Canister is small
customer_reviews.author: KelleeSunshine

customer_reviews.title: I love this. My life is less stressfull trying to ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. My life is less stressfull trying to keep up with vaccuming my home. I can get the floor, under furniture, cobwebs on the ceiling, the crevices between the carpet and the wall.. all in minutes without working up a sweat and not taking me all day. I have a short haired dog that the hairs get stuck in the fabric of our furniture. The ease of this vaccum helps me keep up with routinely cleaning the household and our extra large sofa sectional without dreading doing so. I love all the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! This is an amazing vacuum!!! I researched for a while before deciding on this one and boy am I glad I did! Incredible suction. When they say this deep cleans your carpet they are not kidding. As one other reviewer said, I don't know whether to be excited or horrified! You won't believe what comes out of your carpet! Does floors great too. My only complaint (and it is a small one) is that it is not as light as I had thought. Other than that this is perfection and I highly recommend this vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum! I use it very frequently between having a rabbit and dark rugs that show everything. I can clean ceiling corners, hardwood, and furniture very easily. I usually use the stronger 2 function on rugs because it cleans faster but the 1 function is great for furniture. Very easy to empty out and the filter is just thoroughly rinsed and out to dry for a day. Going strong after 6 months and hopefully for much longer as soon it will be picking up after more pets!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Hannan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Suction
customer_reviews.text: After 2 month of use. Pros: Light weight, LED lights, swivel head and long cord. Cons: Poor suction, attachment location. Did I mention poor suction? We bought this brand again because we really liked the Shark Navigator. I would say after 3 weeks of using the Shark Rocket we noticed the suction was getting weaker. I've replaced and washed the filters several times to hopefully get better results. I bought this based on reviews and would not buy this again ($203.11)
customer_reviews.author: GLZJ

customer_reviews.title: Yep, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Shark Ninja fan for years. Purchased similar model about 5 years ago. It still runs but has been put through the wringer with dog hair, wood burning stove ash and pine needles. I think the key to their longevity is user maintenance. Clean the filters (all three of them..there's three!) and the brush head. Easy to use, assemble, take apart, store (I hang mine) and really light. Worth the money and usually comes with a ton of accessories.
customer_reviews.author: J&M

customer_reviews.title: great little vaccuum
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we moved into a bigger house and I wanted something that would let me easily vacuum stairs. This product worked great for that. I like how light this is as well as easy to switch out the different tools. Unexpectedly I really ended up liking the hardwood floor accessory, it picks up so much dirt/hair and debris while protecting my floors. The brush/vacuum isn't the greatest for a thick pile carpet especially if you have pets. But I have a dyson I use for the heavy duty stuff. Id only use the vacuum on low pile carpets or when you just need a light vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: City girl Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: We have long haired cats and finding a vacuum that can keep up with their shedding has been a constant battle. Think we found a winner. This vacuum does great picking up on carpet, and the hard floor attachment works wonderfully. Lots of suction, great on carpeted steps and hard floors. Ran our old vacuum the on the steps the day before this arrived and then tried the shark there as my test. Picked up so much that I was disgusted with the old vacuum and its abilities. This is a good vacuum for a host of situations. Pretty light weight (for a vacuum), attachments are easy to change, good maneuverability, small storage profile, and easy to dump dust collection.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfThree

customer_reviews.title: My 16 year old daughter likes it too!
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum for me. I love the fact that you can get around, and under things with little effort. The power head works nicely! The fact that you can remove the steel tube to do steps, upholstery, or whatever else you'd need a "Shortie vac" for, makes it worth is by itself. And the power head still brushes if you want it to. The attachments are nice. It's quieter than my $600 Riccar upright that I use for max. vac. cleaning. It's light enough to do the whole house without wearing you, or your arm/shoulder out. My 16 year old daughter uses it way more than our big Vac. That's a plus too!
customer_reviews.author: Screen saver!

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL UPRIGHT VACUUM
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, this Ultra-Light Upright. I have a Shark canister vacuum which has instilled my faith in Shark. Purchased two regular uprights and was very disappointed. This vacuum cleaner has now replaced dragging around my cannister and the attachments are wonderful. It is simple to use and would recommend anyone that has daily battle with pet hair, cat litter (even though vacuum manufacturers, especially SHARK, tell you not to use a vacuum to pick up litter), purchase this upright. The vacuum remains light even when using the attachments, and yes the container that holds the debris does require constant emptying, it is well worth it. Would purchase another one if needed. Very simple to use, a very long cord.
customer_reviews.author: Pattik

customer_reviews.title: very, very pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: I "made do" with my older vacuum (a Hoover Windtunnel) much longer than I should have. After using this lightweight yet powerful Shark, I kicked myself for waiting so long. (Truthfully, I was waiting for the Dysons to go down in price). This is a great vacuum! Lightweight enough for my 60 year old body to carry up and down the stairs, yet strong enough to pick up all of the fur and dirt which our 3 dogs bring in. I am very, very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: an honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Best size and weight
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Shark. Love that I put it together in minutes out of the box. It was very easy. The instructions are easy for the handheld.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Larson

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum kind of sucks, but not in a good way. I mainly use it without attachments as it doesn't seem to pick up anything otherwise. I thought about sending it back, but I do like the handheld aspect and the long cord. Much better suction than my chargeable vacuum, and I like that it is bagless. I usually love Shark products: I have six. However, this is not one of the better ones, in my opinion. For picking up stray litter and cat food as a handheld vac, I do like it. It is only if the brush or other attachment is used that it really doesn't do a good job at all.
customer_reviews.author: Aset

customer_reviews.title: Carpet, Tile, Hardwood, Dog Hair
customer_reviews.text: I have it all in my apartment and this handy dandy vacuum does it all. Very lightweight and fits snug in our tiny closet. I’ve vacuumed dog hair and crumbs off the couch. Bathroom floors full of hair and the Kitchen with all its crumbs. I’m also able to get the air vents and baseboards with the thin tool. I highly recommend this baby it was just what the doctor ordered for a clean home.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: The best of many we've owned.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs and have both Oreck and Hoover pet rated vacuums. Both of these would plug up and shut down about half way across the living room. The cream colored carpet had a light beige tint to them. With one cleaning using the Shark, the carpets went back to their original cream color and we were able to do the whole house in one shot (frequent dumps of the collection cup to compensate for the lack of cleaning from our old vacuums). We love our new Shark and give it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalOilMan

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned a lot better than my full size vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned a lot better than my full size vacuum. It was lighter, more maneuverable, and got to places the full size couldn't. I use it as a full house vacuum. The dirt canister has to be emptied fairly often but I don't see that as a problem. The canister detaches easily, dumps quickly, and reattaches easily. If you have a two story or split level house, you will really like it's light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Flexible Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and tried multiple more expense cordless vacuums. This one is better. It has much better suctions, fits where I need it go and is quite light. I'll take this with its great 90 feet long cord any day over the most expensive of the cordless and cord vacuums for hardwood floors. It works fine on the few rugs I have too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The old model was great but the lower hose to the floor section wore holes. A problem other people had. Tho new model of hv322 is cheaply made and does not come with attachments it used to. Shark didn’t like the review and wouldn’t print it. Hope it’s made in USA and not the shortcuts it has now. Sad. CORD IS SHORTER ALSO. Just discovered that. 4/27/2020
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Dolan

customer_reviews.title: I love the light that makes it easy to see any ...
customer_reviews.text: I have RA, mostly in my hands. I was looking for an alternative to the uprights I've used my whole life. I love the light that makes it easy to see any missed cat litter. Even better, it picked up ALL of the litter the cats have kicked out of the litter box! When I need to replace this vacuum, I'll probably opt for the cordless version, but the cord has great length. I haven't tested yet, but I'm pretty sure I can vacuum ever room in my 950 Sq ft apartment from one centrally located outlet.
customer_reviews.author: willowraven13

customer_reviews.title: Picks up pet hair so well
customer_reviews.text: Love this vac so much, I bought a second for vacation home. I have 3 year round shedders. I think it works best on tile and wooden floors. It really picks up pet hair well. The light is great and is on the wand so when you detach the floor piece, you still have light when using wand only for baseboard or tight places like in closet. It's light weight and easy to empty the cup to clean. I don't think it works as well on carpeting or rugs. The cord is long so you are not having to stop and re plug in that frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: I like this vacuum because its light and flexible
customer_reviews.text: I like this vacuum because its light and flexible. It is also very good on carpet for pet hair. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is for a few reasons. It can't stand up on it's own which is super annoying. There is also poor suction when you take the head of the vacuum off - this was disappointing. Lastly it came with a dirty filter, so I need to buy a replacement one as I didn't find this out until the unit started to overheat. Overall great for pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: Pink_Dragon17

customer_reviews.title: Flex hose breaks!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this vacuum at first and now, a little less than 3 years, I see that the flex hose has broken and that others have had this problem too. After a quick look at other reviews didn't see that Shark has a solution other than expensive replacement. I am looking at other models!
customer_reviews.author: Jane L Cole

customer_reviews.title: This is a great vacuum for hardwood floors and getting under furniture
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vacuum for hardwood floors and getting under furniture. It is great on stairs that are carpeted and switching from hardwood to carpet is just a switch,. No height adjustment is required and the attachments are very useful for autos, furniture lamps etc. I have tested this against our what seem to be more powerful and loud upright vacuums and this equals our best while being more quiet. I like the lights on the vacuum because they stopped putting them on other brands years ago and I think it helps to see under furniture and beds.
customer_reviews.author: Todd White

customer_reviews.title: I have now purchased 2!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these after extensive research for a light vacuum. I originally wanted a battery powered one but decided on this because then I do not have to wait on charging. The plugging and unplugging does not bother me if I can complete the job all at once. It is lightweight and easy to use. Easy to clean. Easy to hide. I bought a second one and my mom loved it so much she took it! Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Nora Bull

customer_reviews.title: CLEANS VERY WELL
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY LIKE THE HANDYNESS OF THIS VACCUM. THE ONLY THING IS THAT IT TAKES TIME TO GET USE TO. IF YOU STOP FOR ANY REASON, YOU HAVE TO LAY THE VACUUM ON THE FLOOR BECAUSE IT WON'T STAND UP BY IT SELF. BUT THE QUALITY AND EASE OF USE IF WORTH THE "GETTING USE TO"
customer_reviews.author: Marlene L. Salerno

customer_reviews.title: This baby is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Who wouldda thunk that a little bit top heavy "stick" of a vacuum would be so wonderful?! It's light, and takes some getting used to because the part on the floor turns easily (almost crazily) if you're not paying attention. But it picks up stuff you didn't know was there and sure can't see. It's easy peasy to empty the small dust/dirt collector container and I loooove the extra long cord that comes with it. And all the extra attachments! I think this is the best vacuum I've ever had and the relatively inexpensive price is a huge bonus. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bus Driver

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats in a small apartment
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super awesome for pet hair. Every vacuum I've seen will still require the brush to be cleaned if it gets full of hair, but this one was designed to be easily cleanable on the head/brush so I always just vacuum the pet hair away. I have a small apartment with area rugs only so it's perfect for me. The small attachment nozzle is nice as well so I can do a few passes over the furniture as well. The suction on it is about what you'd expect for a stick vacuum but very good considering.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney B

customer_reviews.title: Love this little gem
customer_reviews.text: Love this little gem. Great for small areas when you don't want to lug out the larger vacuum. The long cord and light are big pluses! I purchased a small Dyson for three times the price and actually prefer this Shark because it is electric. The suction is the same, but the battery charge on the Dyson is spent after fifteen minutesof use and then it takes three hours to recharge it.
customer_reviews.author: Moorhen

customer_reviews.title: the LED's are great, the attachments (especially the bare floor Dust-Away attachment) ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this vacuum to replace a decent Eureka Smartvac. Immediately after the Shark arrived I used the Eureka to vacuum about 400 square feet of living room and office space. I then used the new Shark Rocket to re-vacuum the same exact area and could not believe what the Shark picked up that the Eureka upright left behind. In fact, the amount of dirt that this small vacuum picks up absolutely requires the 2X collection container the Rocket TruePet has on board. The vacuum is light, the LED's are great, the attachments (especially the bare floor Dust-Away attachment) are well designed and do a great job. I would highly recommend this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Trikker for Life

customer_reviews.title: Awesome job on pet hair on the floor!
customer_reviews.text: So I've had this for less than 12 hrs but I'm already in love! For floors it's the most amazing thing ever!!! My carpets and hard wood floors feel amazing after use and my carpet looks like new. The atachments that allow you to use it hand held are nice but unfortunately it takes a few swipes to pick up my dog's course hair and there are still stragglers. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: Omg best thing ever. I was so tempted by the cordless dyson vaccums but pulled the trigger on the shark instead. I LOVE it. Less money with same if not better quality. Yes it’s corded but who cares. It takes an extra 40secs to move from floor to floor. The wood surface vacuum head is fantastic. This thing is powerful. We have a sheding monster yellow lab. His shedding got nothing on the shark. It gets the job done and more.
customer_reviews.author: Karim Mabrouk

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal! I love this vacuum! My shark pet had just broken down after 2 years (3 Shiba Inus who shed a lot) and I loved that vacuum, very glad I got this replacement. I’ll never buy anything but a Shark vacuum again.
customer_reviews.author: Petra Romer

customer_reviews.title: Great with a Few Drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Suction is good but you have to use the right attachment head or you'll get blow back. I have a lot of hardwood and laminate floors with a few area rugs thrown in. On hardwood/laminate, you have to use the non-carpet head attachment for good results. One downside: you have to unwrap the entire cord before you can change head attachments. Not a good design. Overall a good product
customer_reviews.author: Phelps NY Chick

customer_reviews.title: Still does not get all the dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this vacuum. My sister does... But I have to go over the same spot multiple times and still cannot get all the dog fur. I feel like I just keep doing the same spot and maybe get one additional hair. It works well enough on hardwoods, but terrible on carpets.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy N. Shetterly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is amazing. It has awesome suction and does a great job picking up all the cat hair and cat litter in our house. It is very light weight so it is easy to move around the house and up and down stairs. It is also easy to empty. It is corded so you will never run out of power. Only drawback is that you have to rewind the cord manually. This little upright actually does a better job than my $600 canister vacuum. So happy with this purchase. Don't let the small size and low price fool you... give it a try. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Black

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to a bulky upright.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's lightweight. Easy to steer. Easy to empty and a breeze to clean (just rinse the dustbin, dry and reattach). Doubles as a handheld. Makes vacuuming ceiling vents a possibility. Does a great job as far as sucking up cat hair. The light is useful too. The reason I choose this model is because it comes with extra attachments, which have been quite useful. Also, when stored, the top portion hangs on a little hook toward the bottom of the shaft, which allows it to stand up without falling over, so it takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Not for a long-haired dog
customer_reviews.text: If you strictly want a pet vacuum, I encourage you to keep looking. Dog hair wraps around the brush and has to be cut off. Every time. If you don't mind doing that, however, it's a good, lightweight vacuum. Decent suction. I also have a big Dyson and the Shark is a complementary tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Goodrum

customer_reviews.title: not powerfull enough
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't call this a 'true pet' cleaner. The pet attachment is almost useless. It doesn't seem to have the suction I'm used to. It is adequate as a second vacuum & does a decent job on my mostly hard floors. I like the handheld option & the dirt receptacle that comes right out & is easy to clean out. My other vacuum has a pet attachment that has a carpet type bar with bristles. It is small & easy to handle for pet hairy upholstery. Something Shark should think about.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly B.

customer_reviews.title: Shark attacked floors with gusto!!!
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I could have an audience with the unblocking of the shark ! I cleaned my entire home the day day I opened the shark including washing the floor. Then after we assembled it, we gave it two separate test runs and reallly hard ones too! We were amazed how quickly the unit filled up with dust and hair that was not seen by the invisible eye! Highly recommend this product!!! I would love to do more product reviews for you!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is my Third rocket vacuum, my original one I use in the garage, I bought one from my boyfriend he loves it, and I bought a new one for the house. They have great suction easy to clean easy to store
customer_reviews.author: Donna Marie

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it only because boxing it up is too difficult.
customer_reviews.text: Not crazy about this vacuum. I've had a Shark vacuum for years and have been really happy with it so I thought this one would just be a newer version of a great vacuum. Nope. The fact that it can't stand on it's own is annoying AF. Having to basically build it/put it together whenever I want to use it is annoying too. I'm keeping it only because I'm far too lazy to try and box it all back up again.
customer_reviews.author: Denise S.

customer_reviews.title: This Shark is a Winner
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered the rocket for myself and not as a gift. I really love the way it works and the fact that it's so lightweight. I'm 73 years old and my older vacuum was quite heavy, so I'd often put off vacuuming. I thought I might not like cleaning the vacuum after each use, but it's easy to do. I go outside on the porch to keep any dust that may fly around out of the house. Another feature that I really like is the long cord as I don't have to keep plugging and unplugging the vacuum as I move from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Banks

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this vacuum.I have all hard surface flooring except for carpet on my stairs. It does fine on all. Maybe a little to much for area rugs. It comes apart easily but holds firm when using. adjusts easily and light weight. The hanging plate is a plus for storing
customer_reviews.author: jack isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Shark Rocket TruePet Ultra-Light was probably the best purchase I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: I am 52 year old female with family of 4 and 3 cats. This vacuum cleaner, Shark Rocket TruePet Ultra-Light was probably the best purchase I have ever made. No more fighting big, bulky vacuum around the house. More than half of the furniture that I used to move every time I vacuum, I do not have to move anymore. It is light, powerful, easily movable, changing attachments takes less than a second. With big vacuum I did not use attachments at all, it was honestly frustrating, hard and time consuming, it was easier for me to just dust, brush or clean hard to reach places manually. I am trilled. It saved me, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Tanja

customer_reviews.title: Shark NINJA!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is exactly what my wife and I were looking for. A very versatile and durable vacuum for its style and price point. As another reviewer stated...it's like going from a flip phone to a smart phone!! We have used Dysons for years and still do, but we have been looking for something more versatile for the daily cleaning in and around the kitchen and for the hardwood floors. Well built and performs great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after only a few months of light use
customer_reviews.text: The brush no longer spins after a few months of light use. Terrible quality control for this product. Will never buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad design!
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in my choice to purchase this vacuum. I find the head a bit Too light which makes it difficult to navigate on any surface. The head pops in an upward position which you have to continually push it down. The motor is top heavy also. If it wasn’t such a hassle to return it, I would have. Not a great vacuum at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Musumeci

customer_reviews.title: I love this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum. It does so much more than i realized!!!! Canister is easy to dump and insert back into the rest of the piece. It separates into a few different smaller devices that make cleaning super easy. The ONLY problem I have with it is that it does not stand upright on its on so I've always got to lean it on a piece of furniture while I'm emptying the canister or moving something out of my way. Other than that its perfect for my home.
customer_reviews.author: Delainey

customer_reviews.title: Not happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I've used it three times, I've had it two weeks. Now there's no suction at all, it doesn't pick up anything, and there's a burning smell when I run it. I will be returning this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife to have something light to vacuum hardwood and carpeted stairs. Does a fair job on hardwood but doesn't work on carpet. It is supposed to be able to stand up on its own which it does if you lean against something. We bumped the wall and the filter cover broke off and I have eletric tape holding it on. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: Weight might be too heavy for some
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like the vacuum and my 2 stars have nothing to do with its performance but with the weight. I am a senior and the moment I took it out of the package, I could tell that I do not have the upper body strength to operate the vacuum. This might not be the case for some seniors, but it is for me and I am a very active person. I tried holding the unit in one hand and then in both hands (using it like a hand vac), as you would do with cleaning a couch and it was extremely fatiguing. Regretfully, I packed up the entire unit (without even using it) and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie B.

customer_reviews.title: A pleasure to use works good!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed that the power brush did not come with the vacuum, after reading the description I realized it wasn't included which was my oversight and not a reflection of the product. they are available and now that I have used the vacuum it will be a worth while addition I plan to get. It has good suction and is light and very easy to use. I find it way more user friendly than the expensive Dyson that I have been using and much quietter. The dust cup is very easy to empty and hold a pretty good amount before I need to empty it. Over all I would not hesitate to recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Akins

customer_reviews.title: Your Broom works better!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it it’s here, never works. Now using my broom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonia

customer_reviews.title: New vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I just received the vacuum. First try I love it-suction is great-the canister was pretty full from just a test run! This is my first stick vac so I'm used to the big heavy vacuum's. So far I'm loving it!
customer_reviews.author: John and Kris

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: A nice vacuum is surely a worthy investment for getting my husband working on the carpet:) It's easy to set up/ use/ clean/ maintain!! I had it for 3 months now~ hopefully it would last for at least 3 years~
customer_reviews.author: try to be a smart shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great vaccum!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we got a pup that SHEDS! This vaccum is really good at picking up hair from hard wood and rugs. Not amazing at the short carpet that we have, but still good. Only downside is the small collection container. Able to get under table and chairs with ease. Human hair does wrap around the brush, but there is a groove to run scissors along. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick cleanups, handles dog hair well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this little vac for quick pickups without dragging out the 30-foot central vac hose. Works great for that. And since we have a shedding dog, I'm glad I chose not to buy a rechargeable. The cord is not a big deal, and it's a huge advantage if you need to do more than a room or two. The vac does work great for pet hair, btw. You'll need to empty the canister fairly often, but its clamshell design makes that fairly painless.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Everett

customer_reviews.title: Best lightweight vaccume ever.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 6 months ago. I am completely in love with this Shark. I have 3 dogs. This is perfect. It has two settings. I flip the switch once and it it is perfect for my tile and hardwood, one more click and it sucks all the pet hair out of my carpet. It's light and maneuverable. Can't imagine how you could improve on this machine. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of two

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this Vac. The only down size it that it doesn't stand up on it's own, but I have several spots on my house that it can lean on when I do my floors. I LOVE that I can get under my bed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Best Vacuum Ever Created
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy any other vacuum. This one does it all. Lightweight. Easy to assemble/disassemble. Great suction. Gets under and around everything with ease. Picks up dog hair. Well worth the money. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shark Rocket truepet
customer_reviews.text: Great for me as I have only 1 area rug and tile throughout the house. I have 3 dogs and its mainly to do floors picking up dog hair. The collection cup is not the biggest but very easy to dump and keep on cleaning. I got rid of my canister vac and am pleased with the ease of using the Shark.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley H. Jackowski

customer_reviews.title: Worst suction and worst decision to buy this vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the high ratings. All I can say is this vacuum sucks! Because it doesn't suck. I had a hoover canister vac for about 8 years but my rug beater stopped working. Not expensive, and it was 100% better than this one. I wish I could return! Arg!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use this product quite often for hard wood floors and stone floors. I love the extra attachments. My only complaint, a piece of the Velcro pad on bottom of attachment, has already come off. Wasn’t sure if there were replacements or if I should just glue it back on. Other than that works great
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Living full-time in a fifth-wheel RV, storage is limited. The built-in vacuum did well except for pet hair. This vacuum works great on the pet hair, pulls out dirt in carpeting, and fits perfectly in a small space in the closet. That was one of my worries. I am so glad I purchased this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: nickann

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 years ago and the shark HV322 motorized mini brush stop spinning!! Cleaned it, added some oil to help spinning but nothing! Replacement part is $49 - NO THANKS! The quality of this products is awful!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum, competitive price but supply issues!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum (so far)!!! However, after reading the reviews I came home to double check if I received the correct vacuum and attachments. I did in fact receive the correct vacuum but it didn’t arrive with the pet tool; I thought something was missing when it arrived a couple weeks ago but didn’t double check until today and my suspicions were unfortunately correct. Hopeful that Amazon can rectify these supply issues because it’s a great product and they sell it at a competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hall

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have long hair. My boyfriend has long hair. One of my cats has long hair. We are a long haired multi pet family and this is one of the best vacuums I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love love this vacuum! We have 2 indoor Saint Bernards and I vacuum our living area every day. I love that I don't have to lug out a big vacuum daily to take care of all of this hair! Switching to the handheld vac for my couch is super easy, and the quick release foot pedal makes using the wand even easier. I bought mine in June and just had an issue with the electrical connection that runs the rollers. They shipped me out a new head immediately - no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: rnjsmommy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to vacuum, but this makes cleaning my floors so much easier and quicker. I have laminate flooring and area rugs in most the house and it works wonderfully. Also works very well in my carpeted room. Love the long cord. Super lightweight. The only improvement I can think of is if they could enlarge the dust cup.
customer_reviews.author: REK713

product_meta.title: Shark Rocket DeluxePro Ultra-Light Upright Corded Stick Vacuum, Bordeaux
product_meta.description:
At under 10 lbs., this ultra-lightweight upright vacuum easily converts into a hand vacuum for versatile floor-to-ceiling cleaning. It's equipped with Advanced Swivel Steering, LED headlights to reveal debris, and has an XL-capacity dust cup. It comes with the Duster Crevice Tool, which gives you extended reach into small spaces and the ability to clean a multitude of surfaces, and the Pet Multi-Tool, for capturing embedded pet hair on all surfaces.

BRAND STORY
By Shark
feature_bullets: Powerful 2 in 1 vacuum deep cleans your carpets and hardwood floors
Perfect for quick pick ups; Cord length: 25 feet
Designed to clean everywhere with the included attachments; Rinse both with tap water until the water runs clean, then air dry completely and insert back into your vacuum
Included attachments: Handheld vacuum, motorized floor nozzle, wand, duster crevice tool, pet multi tool

No loss of suction. To clean bare floors, area rugs, or with accessories-Slide the power switch to setting l, Bare Floor, Small Area Rugs. Tilt the handle back while gently stepping on the floor nozzle. The brushrolls will spin slowly in this mode. To clean carpets-Slide the power switch to setting ll, High Pile Carpets. Tilt the handle back while gently stepping on the floor nozzle. The brushrolls will spin quickly in this mode

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,102 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
